shortdesc.ph: Sets the rotation angle of the captured video.
Sets the rotation angle of the captured video.
Sets the rotation angle of the captured video.
Sets the rotation angle of the captured video.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setCameraDeviceOrientation( {required VideoSourceType type, required VideoOrientation orientation});
public abstract int SetCameraDeviceOrientation(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE type, VIDEO_ORIENTATION orientation);

ul.li: This method is for Windows only.

This method must be called after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
When the video capture device does not have a gravity sensor, you can call this method to manually adjust the rotation angle of the captured video.

You must call this method after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, that is, when the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
If the video capture device does not support gravity sensing, you can call this method to manually adjust the rotation angle of the captured video frame.
This method is applicable to Windows only.

You must call this method after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and the local video state is localVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
When the video capture device does not have a gravity sensor, you can call this method to manually adjust the rotation angle of the captured video frame.

This method must be called after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, i.e., when the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).
If the video capture device does not have a gravity sensor, you can call this method to manually adjust the rotation angle of the captured video.

plentry.pd: The type of video source. See .

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
